Posts.Content: Mar 31, 2012 12:13PM twinkies wrote: for nandksmom:  I was wondering what the verbiage on the report means?  what is the next step?
Posts.Title: Biopsies Worries nandksmom Lily55

Posts.Content: twinkies wrote: Brief history - about 1 1/2 years ago a phsician found some swollen cervical lymph nodes - he immediately asked "when was your last mammogram" - it had only been a few month prior and it was clear so he sent me for a CT of the head which came by find and all was dropped.  Figured the nodes must have remained swollen from some unknown cause and while it never went down, my concern was dismissed as "overly anxious" and he wanted me on anti-depressants.  I left his practice and haven't really been to a gp since - I do see my gyno regularly.  I recently found a lump in my right breast and a sono show it to be a cluster of cysts but the report read "highly dense breasts mammographically"  They only looked at the right breast at the time. Fast forward to this week - I've got a small pea size lump (feels smooth and similar to the other one) in my left breast and am scheduled for a mammo and sono in two weeks.  Then it hits me that my clear mammo results for the past few years are probably just a false sense of security - they probably didn't get a good image because of the density!  I've been reading that lymph node involvement above the collar bone (mine swollen note it up my neck a little bit, but below the jaw) could indicate a very serious cancer situation regardless of tumor size. I'm so scared I'm completely nauseous - I'm going to call the imagining center to see if they've had any cancellations and can get me in any sooner.  I struggle with anxiety and my remaining xanax perscription is expired and I'll need to get into my GP to get it renewed.  What are the odds that swollen lymph node (it's still swollen, but no bigger than it was 1 1/2 years ago) would have stayed constant if it was swollen from cancer cells?  How am I going to get through the next two weeks?  Please help. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Please help - I'm so scared twinkies Outfield

Posts.Content: Apr 1, 2012 10:06PM twinkies wrote: I appreciate your responses so much and sincerely thank you.Robo and Harley - you are very kind to jump in and respond.  CoolBreeze - what you said makes very good sense - if that lymph node was swollen 18 months ago, surely I would not feel healthy today.   I am my own worst enemy -hopefully I can get in sooner. Again - I greatly appreciate your responses.
Posts.Title: Please help - I'm so scared twinkies Outfield

Posts.Content: Apr 2, 2012 08:59AM twinkies wrote: Thank you to everyone who took the time to reply - what a wonderful group of people to help - and I promise I'll try to stay off the internet. I appreciate your thoughts so much and I'll post with any updates. God Bless everyone here and I hope everyone has a wonderful week.
